stem: An adjustment has just been completed on the packing gland of a motor-operated gate valve to stop a minor stem leak. Which one of the following can occur if the technician overtightened the packing gland? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Decreased cooling flow to the valve internals.
choices.B: Separation of the valve disk from the valve stem.
choices.C: Misalignment of the valve position limit switches.
choices.D: Increased stroke time from fully open to fully closed. -50- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following describes the function and use of the backseat on a manual valve?

choices.A: Removes pressure from the packing/stuffing box and is typically used to isolate the stuffing box for valve repacking.
choices.B: Removes pressure from the packing/stuffing box and is typically used when needed to isolate packing leakage.
choices.C: Acts as a backup in case the primary seat leaks and is typically used during system isolation for personnel protection.
choices.D: Acts as a backup in case the primary seat leaks and is typically used when needed to prevent the primary seat from leaking excessively.

stem: When manually closing a motor-operated valve, why must the operator avoid using excessive valve seating force? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The valve may bind and cause the motor to trip on overload during subsequent remote operation.
choices.B: The valve actuator clutch may be damaged and disable subsequent remote operation.
choices.C: The valve stem limit switches may be damaged and cause inaccurate remote valve position indication.
choices.D: The valve actuator position indicator may be damaged and cause inaccurate local valve position indication. -51- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a water supply pump with two suction sources (see figure below). All motor-operated valves (MOVs) are currently closed. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Neither MOV-1 nor MOV-2 can be opened unless MOV-3 is fully closed.
choices.B: None of the MOVs can be opened unless at least one MOV remains fully closed.
choices.C: None of the MOVs can be opened unless at least two MOVs remain fully closed.
choices.D: Neither MOV-1 nor MOV-2 can be opened unless the other source MOV is fully closed. -52- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of two valves used in a high temperature water system (see figure below). Both valves are currently closed, as shown in the figure. The valve that is more likely to become stuck due to mechanical binding as the valve cools down is number _____; and the valve that is more likely to become stuck due to a pressure lock as the valve heats up is number _____. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: 2; 2 -53- PWR Test Items

stem: After manually positioning a typical motor-operated valve, the valve actuator motor is reengaged by...

choices.A: taking the manual declutch lever to the disengage position.
choices.B: taking the manual declutch lever to the engage position.
choices.C: racking in the valve actuator motor breaker.
choices.D: energizing the valve actuator motor.

stem: When the manual declutch lever of a motor-operated valve is moved out of the normal position, it __________ the motor and __________ the handwheel. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: disengages; disengages -54- PWR Test Items

stem: A typical motor-operated valve with a declutch lever is installed in a system. An actuation signal is designed to energize the valve motor and open the valve. The valve is currently open, but being manually/locally closed by a technician as required by a surveillance test procedure. The declutch lever has been operated and released, and the valve is being closed by operation of the valve handwheel. If an actuation signal is received, how will the valve be affected?

choices.A: The handwheel will disengage and the valve will automatically open.
choices.B: The handwheel will disengage and the valve will remain in the current position.
choices.C: The handwheel will remain engaged and the valve will automatically open.
choices.D: The handwheel will remain engaged and the technician can continue to close the valve.

stem: A surveillance test procedure is being performed on a typical motor-operated valve (MOV) with a declutch lever. The declutch lever has been operated and released, and the valve is being manually/locally opened by a technician. The MOV breaker is closed as required by the surveillance test procedure. During operation of the valve handwheel, an actuation signal is received that normally energizes the valve motor and closes the valve. How will the valve be affected by the actuation signal? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The handwheel will disengage and the valve will automatically close.
choices.B: The handwheel will disengage and the valve will remain in the current position.
choices.C: The handwheel will remain engaged and the valve will automatically close.
choices.D: The handwheel will remain engaged and the technician can continue to open the valve. -55- PWR Test Items

stem: A typical motor-operated valve (MOV) has just been opened from the main control room, and the breaker for the MOV has been opened. A plant operator has been directed to close the MOV locally for a surveillance test. If the operator attempts to turn the MOV handwheel in the clockwise direction without first operating the declutch lever, which one of the following will occur?

choices.A: The handwheel will turn, but the valve stem will not move.
choices.B: The handwheel will not turn, and the valve stem will not move.
choices.C: The handwheel will turn, and the valve stem will move toward the closed position because the clutch is automatically engaged when the handwheel is turned.
choices.D: The handwheel will turn, and the valve stem will move toward the closed position because the clutch is automatically engaged when the breaker is opened.

stem: Which one of the following types of similarly sized valves requires the most manual valve stem rotation to move the valve from fully open to fully closed? (Assume that each valve has a non- rising stem.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Butterfly -56- PWR Test Items

stem: A stop check valve is a type of check valve that...

choices.B: can be used to prevent flow in both directions.
choices.C: contains both a gate valve disk and a check valve disk.
choices.D: can be opened manually to allow flow in both directions.

stem: Which one of the following valves is used to control the direction of fluid flow and prevent backflow in a system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Check valve -57- PWR Test Items

stem: Two common types of check valves used in nuclear power plants are...

choices.D: needle and angle.

stem: A typical check valve is designed to... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: permit flow in only one direction.
choices.D: perform automatic pump venting. -58- PWR Test Items

stem: Check valves are normally used to prevent...

choices.A: overpressurization of nonoperating system piping and components.
choices.B: backflow through nonoperating components or flowpaths.
choices.C: pump runout by providing a constant backpressure.
choices.D: pump cavitation by keeping nonoperating systems filled.

stem: Which one of the following is the type of valve used to control the direction of fluid flow through a system and prevent backflow? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Check valve -59- PWR Test Items

stem: To verify that a manual valve in a pressurized water system is closed, the operator should observe valve position indication and operate the valve handwheel in the...

choices.A: close direction using normal force, and verify there is no substantial handwheel movement.
choices.B: close direction using normal force, then turn the handwheel an additional one-half turn using additional force if necessary.
choices.C: open direction until flow sounds are heard, then close the valve using normal force until the handwheel stops moving.
choices.D: open direction until the valve stem moves, then close the valve using normal force until the handwheel stops moving.

stem: To verify the position of a fully open manual valve in an operating system, the operator should operate the valve handwheel... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: in the open direction until the valve is backseated one-half turn.
choices.B: to fully close the valve, then open the valve to the fully open position.
choices.C: in the closed direction, then open the valve to its previously open position.
choices.D: to open the valve until it touches the backseat, then close the valve to the desired position. -60- PWR Test Items

stem: Consider a typical gate valve and a typical globe valve in the same water system application. The globe valve generally has a __________ pressure drop when fully open; and is __________ commonly used for throttling system flow.

choices.D: larger; less

stem: Gate valves should not be used to throttle fluid flow because... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: the tortuous flow path through a gate valve body makes flow control difficult.
choices.B: gate valves must be fully opened and backseated to prevent stem leakage.
choices.C: the turbulent flow created by a partially opened gate valve will cause erosion damage to the valve seat.
choices.D: the large size of the gate valve disk requires an oversized actuator to accurately position the disk. -61- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a valve (see figure below). Which one of the following describes the type of valve shown? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: Nonrising-stem gate valve -62- PWR Test Items

stem: Consider a 3-inch gate valve and a 3-inch globe valve in the same flowing water system application. If both valves are fully open, the globe valve produces the __________ head loss and the __________ flow rate.

choices.D: smaller; smaller

stem: Which one of the following is a generally accepted method for locally verifying that a manual valve is fully closed in a depressurized static piping system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Check a downstream flow gauge to be indicating zero flow.
choices.B: Visually observe the valve rising-stem threading to be fully exposed.
choices.C: Attempt to turn the valve handwheel in the close direction and verify no movement.
choices.D: Compare an upstream and downstream pressure gauge to ensure zero differential pressure. -63- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between a typical gate valve and a typical globe valve in the same water system application with both valves fully open, the gate valve has a __________ pressure drop and is normally used in __________ flow applications.

choices.D: smaller; on/off

stem: To verify a manual valve in an operating system is closed, the operator should observe valve position indication and operate the valve handwheel in the... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: open direction at least one full rotation, then close the valve using normal force.
choices.B: open direction until system flow is observed, then close the valve using normal force.
choices.C: close direction using normal force and verify there is no substantial handwheel movement.
choices.D: close direction using normal force, then operate the valve handwheel an additional one-quarter turn in the close direction. -64- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is a disadvantage associated with using a gate valve, versus a globe valve, to throttle flow in a cooling water system?

choices.A: The tortuous flow path through a throttled gate valve body makes flow control difficult.
choices.B: A gate valve will experience stem leakage unless it is fully opened and backseated.
choices.C: The turbulent flow created by a throttled gate valve will cause erosion damage to the valve seat.
choices.D: A fully-open gate valve will produce a greater system head loss than a fully-open globe valve.

stem: After an adjustment of the packing gland on a valve that had a minor packing leak, the operator attempts to operate the valve, but finds that the valve is stuck. What is the most probable cause? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The disk separated from the valve stem as a result of overtightening the packing gland.
choices.B: The operator placed the valve in the wrong position for adjusting the packing gland.
choices.C: The valve was overtorqued in the close direction during the packing gland adjustment.
choices.D: The maintenance technician overtightened the packing gland, causing the stem to bind. -65- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following is not a generally accepted method for locally verifying that a valve is open?

choices.B: Check the local valve position indicator indicates OPEN.
choices.C: Turn the valve operator in the close direction and verify that some movement occurs.
choices.D: Attempt to turn the valve operator in the open direction and verify that no movement occurs.

stem: Why are gate valves generally not used to throttle water flow? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Rapid changes in flow direction inside the valve cause a large unrecoverable system head loss.
choices.B: Gate valves experience stem leakage unless they are fully open or fully closed.
choices.C: The turbulent flow created by a partially opened gate valve causes excessive seat and disk wear.
choices.D: Flow rate through a gate valve is not proportional to the differential pressure across the valve. -66- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between globe valves and gate valves in the same water system application, globe valves...

choices.A: are less effective at throttling flow.
choices.B: are less effective as pressure regulating valves.
choices.C: produce a smaller pressure decrease when fully open.
choices.D: require less force to open against large differential pressures.

stem: In a comparison between gate valves and globe valves in the same water system application, gate valves... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: are more effective at throttling flow.
choices.B: are more effective as pressure regulating valves.
choices.C: produce a larger pressure decrease when fully open.
choices.D: require more force to open against large differential pressures. -67- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between butterfly valves and ball valves, __________ valves are generally more leak- tight in high pressure applications; and __________ valves generally exhibit the smaller pressure decrease when fully open.

choices.D: butterfly; butterfly

stem: A gate valve is generally a poor choice for throttling fluid flow because... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: the turbulent flow created by a partially opened gate valve can cause extensive damage to the valve.
choices.B: the tortuous path through a gate valve body can make flow control difficult.
choices.C: excessive stem leakage will result unless the gate valve is fully open or fully closed.

stem: In a comparison between ball valves and butterfly valves in the same water system application, the valve that typically would allow more leakage when fully closed with a high differential pressure is the __________ valve; and the valve that typically would cause the greater pressure loss when fully open is the __________ valve.

choices.D: butterfly; ball

stem: A typical motor-operated valve has been returned to service following a complete maintenance overhaul of the valve and actuator. The valve was remotely opened and closed to verify operability. The measured valve stroke time in each direction was 15 seconds, which is 25 percent longer than normal. Which one of the following could have caused the increased stroke time? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: The valve position limit switches were removed and were not reinstalled.
choices.B: The valve torque limit switches were misadjusted to open at half their normal setpoints.
choices.C: The valve was packed with improved packing material having a lower friction coefficient.
choices.D: The valve stem packing gland was overtightened after the packing material was replaced. -69- PWR Test Items

stem: In a comparison between ball valves and butterfly valves in the same water system application, the valve that would typically be more leak-tight when fully closed with a high differential pressure is the __________ valve; and the valve that typically results in the greater pressure decrease when fully open is the __________ valve.

choices.D: butterfly; ball

stem: In a comparison between ball valves and butterfly valves in the same cooling water system application, the valve that would typically experience the greater seat leakage when fully closed with a large differential pressure is the __________ valve; and the valve that would typically cause the smaller head loss when fully open is the __________ valve. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: butterfly; ball -70- PWR Test Items

stem: During a local inspection of a manually-operated 12-inch gate valve, the valve stem is observed to extend outward from the valve handwheel by 1 inch. choices.C: The valve may be in any position, because it is a rising stem gate valve.
choices.D: The valve may be in any position, because it is a non-rising stem gate valve.

stem: A typical motor-operated valve has been returned to service following a complete maintenance overhaul of the valve and actuator. When the valve was remotely opened and closed to verify operability, the measured valve stroke time in each direction was 15 seconds, which is shorter than normal for this valve. choices.A: The valve position limit switches were removed and were not reinstalled.

choices.A: The valve is fully open or nearly fully open.
